description: Friends of Feltham Green would like to invite you to a walking history tour of Feltham's ponds and places connected to Freddie Mercury who once lived in Feltham.  Plus learn about the amazing Market Garden/Horticultural history.

events.name: Feltham's ponds history and Freddie Mercury tour
events.notes: Visitors can arrive at any time during the opening hours.There may be queues at busy times.

events.name: Feltham Ponds History and Freddie Mercury Tour
events.notes: Visitors can arrive at any time during the opening hours.There may be queues at busy times.

factsheet.heading: Feltham name-place meaning
paragraphs: Feltham's history commences with its entry in the Domesday Survey of 1086, where the earliest spelling of its place-name (Felteha) appears.  The name Feltham is Feldham meaning a village in a field or on an open plain.  Another derivation is from Felte (meaning soft or woolly leaved), which is the Old English plant name for Mullein - genus Verbascum.  Later spelling of the place-name were Feltesham in 1274, Felten in 1668 and finally by 1800 Feltham.

factsheet.heading: Farms and Market Gardens of Feltham
paragraphs: Feltham was a farming community from the time of Domesday until the end of the 18th Century.   Then many of the farms went over to market gardening, providing the increasing population of London with fresh fruit and vegetables.

One of the oldest known farms was that of Haubergers, later known as Feltham Farm.  in the 19th Century this became a market garden run by our most famous Alfred William Smith.  Who had his own railway and 'Glass City' which consisted of 10 acres of greenhouses (one greenhouse was 600 ft long and 32 ft wide).
Blaize Farm opposite, whose farmhouse dated back to the 17th century, was possibly the location where the great fire of Feltham started in 1634 (hence the name of the farm).

factsheet.heading: Famous London Nurserymen connected to Feltham
paragraphs: In the 1800 London Nurserymen from Convent Garden, Kensington, Chelsea and Fulham needed more land.  So they brought plots of land in the villages on the out skirts of London.  Feltham was one of those villages, that nurserymen like Harry Veitch, Lee and Kennedy, Wills and Seager and Watkins and Simpson brought land and left a ever lasting horticultural legacy to the town.

factsheet.heading: Friends of Feltham Green
paragraphs: Friends of Feltham Green is a community group that works very hard with Hounslow Council/Greenspace360 to highly maintain Feltham Green/pond and the Freddie Mercury Memorial (soon garden also).   The group working alongside Feltham in Bloom and Friends of Bridge House Pond to showcase Feltham's wonderful Horticultural history and to bring back Feltham's flowers to our greenspaces.

Going through the pandemic it was highlighted greatly how important our parks/greenspaces are to us.  Not only to get outside to exercise but for mental wellbeing.   Seeing flowers and connecting to nature is something we all shouldn't take for granted.
The community of Feltham and Freddie Mercury Fans worldwide has come together to help support the group to make Feltham Green the special place it deserves to be.

factsheet.heading: Freddie Mercury Memorial
paragraphs: The original Freddie Mercury Memorial in Feltham's town Centre was unveiled on 24th September 2009 by his mother Jer, sister Kashmira and Brian May who also once lived in Feltham just round the corner to Freddie's house 22, Gladstone Ave.

It was subsequently relocated and now stands on Feltham Green near the High Street, and is lovingly cared for by the Friends of feltham Green, a voluntary organisation.  A garden will be created around the memorial for local residents to enjoy and for fans from arund the world to lay tributes.  The star was originally coloured black but now shines gold as kashmira wished.

factsheet.heading: Road sign ' Freddie Mercury Close'
paragraphs: The World Zoroastrian Organisation at Bridge House, Feltham needed a personalised address for people to locate their headquarters.  With help from the Mayor of Hounslow, the location was renamed Freddie Mercury Close.  The new road sign was unveiled by Freddie's sister Kashmira Bulsara, on 24th February 2020.

factsheet.heading: English Heritage Blue Plaque Freddie Mercury House
paragraphs: Freddie Mercury (Farrokh Bulsara) moved to Feltham from Zanzibar in 1964 along with his family to 22, Gladstone Avenue.  The English Heritage Blue Plaque celebrates Freddie's link to Feltham and can be seen on the front of the house.  It was unveiled by Queen guitarist, Brian May and Freddie's sister Kashmira on 1st September 2016.

factsheet.heading: Feltham's ponds
paragraphs: Feltham has only 3 remaining ponds, Feltham Pond, Bridge House and Clymping Dene.   Once the village had 7 ponds which some was man made due to gravel excavation but others was natural, remnants of the last ice age 10,000 years ago.  Each pond has its own character and history but faces the most challenging century the 21st.   Through the walkie talks each pond will be explained its history, Geology and Ecology.

images.title: Unveiling of Heritage Plaque Freddie Mercury House Feltham
